channel.title: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!
channel.description:
Every time I try to make a RaR file for my source, I get an error message. You see, RETARD SYIpkpker keeps spamming me and now his char file isnt a Txt document. Its not on my compute at all, but still in my source files.
I reallyyyyyyyyyy need to shred this file but I dont have the least bit of clue how to. Please help? Thanks. PS. I tried to make files into Txt documents and nothong worked :(

item.title: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

if you have vista, it could be a indexing problem. The file try finding on the windows help on how to refresh indexing files. Fixed my homework that went all weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

I got this once, it’s easy to fix, all you have to do is zip your source file using WinRaR or whatever you use, and you’ll get an error message, well, keep letting it zip, and it’ll zip it, but the messed up character files wont be in there when you unzip it.

Read full topic

item.title: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:14, topic:230567”][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=303542.msg2434365#msg2434365 date=1221090671]
Don’t make shortcuts? Just use shift key and ctrl key to pick all the files except char folder, add to archive, and do what I mentioned there, add an empty char folder afterwards.
[/quote]
Kk trying that now.
Dont mean to sound like a nub but ive never created an archive b4. How do I add to it?[/quote]
I haven’t used windows for long while, so couldn’t tell you how to do it with winrar; look around in the UI.

Read full topic

item.source: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!

item.title: Shredding files? Need this to release my source!
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Some people somehow made strange char files on my server once too. They’re extension was like .sys or something, so the computer wouldn’t let me delete it. I used my .bat converter (by me) to change its extension.

All you have to do if you don’t wanna make a batch file to do it is go to tools (in the char file window) and click folder options, then (i think) the advanced tab, then find the option to show file extensions. Make sure its on, then save and close the folder options. Now go to your “bad” file and change it’s extension to like .txt or .doc or something common. Should be deletable now.

Read full topic
